body.p: In March 2009 the Boards published a joint Discussion Paper Leases: Preliminary Views. The Discussion Paper set out the Boards’ preliminary views on lessee accounting, proposing a ‘right-of-use’ accounting model. Feedback on the Discussion Paper generally supported the ‘right-of-use’ model for lessees, by which a lessee would recognise a right-of-use asset and a lease liability at the commencement date of the lease. The Discussion Paper did not discuss lessor accounting in any detail.
